subject: Re: Programming By Contract
msgSnippet: ... What about in a production system where I don t want a poor end user to be troubled with 20 or so lines of exception stack trace, and more importantly, I
messageBody:
--- In junit@egroups.com, Robert Sartin <sartin@a...> wrote:
>
> --- Robert Sartin <sartin@a...> wrote:
> >Assertion failures should be caught. Meyer is right on this.
>
> Once more with feeling and correctness:
>
> Assertion failures should *never* be caught. Meyer is right on this.

What about in a production system where I don't want a poor end user
to be troubled with 20 or so lines of exception stack trace, and more
importantly, I want to ask them very nicely to report the error to
tech support.

Or even worse, it's a Web app and Joe Public is using it, and I want
to redirect them to an ever-so-nice error page.

Or even even worse, it's a web app and the client is using it from
home one night just before he signs the final cheque...

>
> Regards,
>
> Rob
>
>
